original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields up at close, rupee at 315.50/316 against the USD
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT- Sri Lanka’s bond yields closed higher on Wednesday and the rupee closed at 315.50/316 against the US dollar in the spot market, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.09.2027 closed at 28.60/90 percent, up from 28.30/50 percent at yesterday’s close.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 30.50/75 percent on Wednesday, up from 30.00/25 percent at last close.
A three months- maturing bill closed at 25.30/80 percent on Wednesday, steady from 25.75/85 percent at last close.
The rupee closed at 315.50/316 against the US dollar in the spot market appreciated from the last close at 317.50/318.50. (Colombo/May10/2023)
